resources.string: 100% of your contributions to the Farmer’s Fund and through this app will go towards the coffee farmers.
Explore The History Of Your Coffee
Ground yesterday, your cup of Kati Kati blend was brewed at 95 C, to extract all the flavour from the coffee.
The coffee beans were sun-dried by spreading on the drying tables. Once the beans were dried from approximately 60% moisture content to 11-12% moisture content, they are readied for export.
Azizi has been a coffee farmer for over 30 years. He spends 12 hours on the field almost everyday, trying to harvest as much as he is able to.
Swahili for “between”, Kati Kati strikes a balance between the citrus and spice nots from Kenya and the subtle floral aromas from Ethiopia
